pages.text: HoneyCharge (HC) is the energy system that powers all ApiElectric machines. This unique form of energy is measured in HoneyCharge Units (HCU) and is generated exclusively by Energy Bees.$(br2)Understanding how to generate, store, and transfer HoneyCharge is essential for advancing through the mod.

pages.title: Generation
pages.text: HoneyCharge is generated when Energy Bees return to an Energy Apiary after visiting Energized Flowers. Each bee generates 5-10 HC per trip, and a fully operational apiary with 5 bees can generate up to 250 HC/minute.

pages.title: Storage
pages.text: Several blocks can store HoneyCharge:$(br)- Energy Apiary: 5,000 HC$(br)- Comb Capacitor: 40,000 HC$(br)- Honey Charge Conduit: 2,000 HC$(br)- Honey Charge Furnace: 10,000 HC$(br)- Pollen Transducer: 20,000 HC

pages.title: Transfer
pages.text: Honey Charge Conduits are the primary method of transferring energy between machines. They can transfer up to 500 HCU/tick and will glow when active.

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: HoneyCharge powers various machines:$(br)- Honey Charge Furnace: Faster smelting$(br)- Pollen Transducer: Converts HC to other energy types$(br)- More machines to be discovered...

pages.title: Checking Energy Levels
pages.text: To check the energy level of any HC-compatible block:$(br)1. Hold Shift while looking at the block$(br)2. The tooltip will show current charge level$(br)3. A colored progress bar indicates the percentage full$(br)- Green: >66%$(br)- Yellow: 33-66%$(br)- Red: <33%
